movies.title: The Valley (Obscured by Clouds)
movies.plot: Viviane, a French Consul's wife, is in New Guinea to find exotic feathers for export to Paris. She encounters four European travelers who are en route to "La Vallée": The Valley, high in the Guinean mountains, is shown on maps as 'Obscured by Clouds' and is beyond their previous experiences. Viviane joins their trek to find rare feathers and soon becomes entwined in their journey. Their extended stay with the Mapuga tribe brings a denouement between western and indigenous values before their final quest toward the 'Valley of the Gods'.
movies.simplePlot: Filmmaker Barbet Schroeder explores themes of sexual freedom, mind alteration, and pursuit of paradise against the backdrop of an early 70's encounter with the Mapuga rain forest tribe in upland New Guinea.

biography.bio: Jérôme Beauvarlet is an actor, known for Last Exit Before Roissy (1977) and The Valley (Obscured by Clouds) (1972).
biography.name: Jérôme Beauvarlet

biography.bio: Monique Giraudy is an actress and assistant director, known for Jupiter (1971), More (1969) and Identification of a Woman (1982).
biography.name: Monique Giraudy

biography.bio: Best remembered in Britain for the television series Arthur of the Britons (1972), Ken Russell 's The Devils (1971) and as the villain in For Your Eyes Only (1981). His break into films came with Don Levy's Herostratus (1967). Michael was unmarried, living in Hampstead, England and under treatment for depression at the time of his suicide in 1992.
biography.name: Michael Gothard

biography.bio: Jean-Pierre Kalfon was born on October 30, 1938 in Paris, France. He is an actor and composer, known for Weekend (1967), Confidentially Yours (1983) and Saint-Cyr (2000).
biography.name: Jean-Pierre Kalfon

biography.bio: Valérie Lagrange was born on February 25, 1942 in Paris, France as Daniele Charaudeau. She is an actress, known for A Man and a Woman (1966), Queen to Play (2009) and Mes nuits sont plus belles que vos jours (1989).
biography.name: Valérie Lagrange

biography.bio: Bulle Ogier was born on August 9, 1939 in Boulogne-Billancourt, Seine [now Hauts-de-Seine], France as Marie-France Thielland. She is an actress and writer, known for The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie (1972), Venus Beauty (1999) and The Gang of Four (1989). She is married to Barbet Schroeder.
biography.name: Bulle Ogier

camera: Arriflex 35 IIC, Cooke Lenses, Angénieux Zoom

keywords: having sex with skirt hiked up
